frontMatter.title: Files
frontMatter.description: Follow this pattern to help users upload files and provide required documentation.
frontMatter.intro: Use this pattern when users must upload files to provide required documentation for their application.

when_to_use.value: **Required documentation.** When a user must upload a file to provide required documentation for their application.

design_principles.value: **Use clear terminology.** Use 'upload' and 'delete' rather than 'add', 'remove', or 'edit'.
**Prefer 'file' over 'document'.** The term 'file' has broader applicability.
**Validate thoroughly.** Check mime-type and file extension matching, verify UTF encoding.
**Handle encrypted PDFs.** Detect encrypted PDFs and prompt for password when needed.
**Require confirmation for deletion.** Use two-step confirmation before deleting uploaded files.

when_not_to_use.value: **Non-essential files.** When files don't impact service delivery.
**Batch uploads.** Avoid batch uploading scenarios which are mobile-unfriendly and create UX/technical issues.

examples.title: Default file upload
examples.description: File input with instructions about accepted file types and size limits.

examples.title: Review uploaded file
examples.description: Card displaying filename with change and delete options.

examples.title: Delete confirmation
examples.description: Modal confirming the user wants to delete an uploaded file.

how_to_build.intro: The file upload pattern guides users through uploading and managing documentation.

steps.value: Header clearly describing what file to upload.
Instructions explaining file type requirements and why the file is needed.
Bullet list of permitted file types and size limits.
Review state: Card displaying filename with change/delete options.
Delete state: Confirmation modal for destructive action.

frontMatter.code_usage:
The file upload pattern uses the File input component with validation.

**Validation requirements:**
- Check mime-type and file extension matching
- Verify UTF encoding for proper handling
- Detect encrypted PDFs and prompt for password

See the [vets-website repository](https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/vets-website) for implementation details.

content_considerations.value: Provide explicit action language in instructions.
Clearly list accepted file types and maximum file size.

accessibility.value: Avoid italicizing help text about file types and sizes.
Require two-step confirmation before deleting files.
Provide clear, actionable error messages explaining upload failures.
Ensure support for screen reader and magnification users.
The file input must have a visible, associated label.
